intro: Baeobotrys pubescens, commonly known as the hairy baeobotrys, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Baeobotrys pubescens is often found in open woodlands and along riverbanks, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
